data.text: @mosermusic @CPSCovid @miriamcb It would be interesting to compare with the Kinsa temperature data mapping.

@mosermusic @CPSCovid @miriamcb Yes. I was thinking that if I converted it to some sort of visual equivalent patterns might show up but I wasn’t sure whether a straight line graph would work with data chunked like that plus percentages.
@CPSCovid @shawphd @miriamcb It reminds me of CPS's approach to data, which is to give you a lot of data but isolated from the larger context that would help to make it meaningful

@CPSCovid @shawphd @miriamcb or other indicators to help contextualize the wastewater numbers, like deaths, infections, hospitalizations, etc; if you could see wastewater data compared to other things, it would be easier to tell if this resembled a period before a spike or not

@CPSCovid @shawphd @miriamcb Caveat, this is a new kind of data to me. I am reluctant to draw conclusions based on this graph, in part because I don't think they're presenting things clearly. It seems strange to me that the core metric is change over a 15 day period but they don't have a time series graph

@shawphd @mosermusic @miriamcb To be clear, its hard to tell, but it has been jumping between 33% and 50% for two weeks (in the one place) so I don't think it is clear if that 252% increase is meaningful or if it is gonna go down to 10% tomorrow. Lower signal often leads to more noise.
@CPSCovid @mosermusic @miriamcb Thank you. These things need explainers. Badly.
@mosermusic @CPSCovid @miriamcb I’m okay with confirmation that my hair is, in fact, on fire.
